result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Steeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Defendant to submit DNA sample; pay $250 surcharge. Review to be done in nine months.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph D Steeger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Two discharge certificates filed by DOC
Defendant discharged from probation on 6-8-17 with no unpaid financial obligations
Order for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d)
from probation agent Ashley T. with proposed Order for Early Discharge from probation
Status hearing on March 8, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Agent Tassoul requests probation review hearing to be set - fax

Cases called: 15CF521 & 16CF62, Defendant, Joseph D Steeger, appeared pro se. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney recited. Defendant waived.  Waiver of preliminary hearing waived. Reading waived on Information. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in 16CF62 and ct. 1 in 15CF521. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on ct. 1 in  16CF62: 45 days jail, consecutive to jail in 15CF521. Good time granted. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08  $1,379 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. $65 blood draw fee. 15 month revocation, 15 month IID. Submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Bailjumping in 16CF62 read in and dismissed.  In 16CF62, two days jail credit granted. 
In 15CF521, 2 yr. probation, conditions: review in 9 months, 60 days jail to commence April 15, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08, $518 costs. Complete AODA and follow all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit.

Defendant, Joseph D Steeger, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  $1000.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Joseph D Steeger not in Court.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requesting warrant, refer to Br. 3 for warrant, 15 TR 4178, default judgment entered, $175.30 forfeiture
